revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Public transit |name = Tehran Metro |image = Tehran Metro Logo.svg |imagesize = 144px |locale = {{flagicon|Iran}} [[Tehran]] |transit_type = [[Rapid transit]] (line 1,2,4)
[[Regional rail]] (line 5) |began_operation = 1971 |ended_operation = |system_length = {{convert|120|km|mi|1|abbr=on}} |lines = 4 |vehicles = |stations = 69 |ridership = 2 million (January 2011)http://tehranmetro.com/News.aspx?pid=26&cid=46&iid=416 | annual_ridership = 459.1 million (2008)http://tehranmetro.com/AppUploadedFiles/Statistics/d0eb80de-b652-45d0-8d91-aa560a1c316d.pdfhttp://tehranmetro.com/AppUploadedFiles/Statistics/b5ff4bc0-bc77-488e-8e5a-1b85f6b8e36f.pdf |track_gauge = standard |reporting marks = |operator = |owner = Tehran Urban and Suburban Railway Company |map = }} The '''Tehran Metro''' is a [[rapid transit]] system serving [[Tehran]], the capital of [[Iran]]. The system consists of 4 operational lines, with construction having begun on a further two lines in 2007. The line uses standard gauge. Ticket price is 1200 [[Iranian Rial|IRR]] for each journey (about [[$|USD]] 0.10), regardless of distance. On all Tehran metro trains, the first and last carriages are reserved for women who do not wish to ride with men in the same car. However, women can still ride other cars freely.[https://docs.google.com/viewer?url=http://www.tehranmetro.com/AppUploadedFiles/Statistics/a0f2801a-fcdb-4ff1-b87a-5291b79c07fd.pdf]http://www.youtube.com/user/PressTVGlobalNews#p/u/10/lFFX0RF3ML0 The Tehran Metro carries more than 2 million passengers a day.http://in.reuters.com/article/2011/03/05/idINIndia-55349520110305 In 2010, 459 million trips were made on Tehran Metro. http://www.payvand.com/news/11/jan/1221.html ==History== [[Image:Tehran Metro-Azadi Station.jpg|right|200px|thumb|Tehran Metro System]] [[Image:Tehran subway.jpg|thumb|200px|Tehran Metro]] The initial plans of the '''Tehran Metro''', which was to be [[Iran]]'s first metro system, were laid out before the Iranian revolution in the 1970s. In 1970 the Plan and Budget Organization and the Municipality of [[Tehran]] announced an international [[Request for tender|tender]] for construction of a metro in Tehran. The French company [[SOFRETU]], affiliated with the state-owned Paris transportation authority [[RÃ©gie Autonome des Transports Parisiens|RATP]], won the tender and in the same year began to conduct preliminary studies on the project. In 1974, a final report with a so-called 'street-metro' proposal was tendered. The street-metro system recommended a road network with a loop express way in the central area and 2 highways for new urban areas and a 8-line metro network which were complemented by bus network and taxi services. Geological surveys commenced in 1976. In 1978 construction on the line was started in northern Tehran by the [[France|French]] company, however this development was short-lived with the advent of the [[Iranian Revolution]] and [[IranâIraq War]] in 1979 and 1980 respectively. SOFRETU ceased operations in Iran in December 1980. On March 3, 1982, the Iranian Cabinet ministers formally announced the stop of Tehran Metro operations by the French company. In 1985, the "Tehran Metro Execution Plan" was re-approved by [[Majles]] (Iran Parliament) on the basis of legal project of "Amendment of Law of Establishment of Tehran Urban and suburban Railway Company" which had been founded on Farvardin 1364 (April 1985). This was a literal continuation of exactly the same project that had been laid out before the revolution. Work proceeded slowly due to the continuing [[IranâIraq War]] and often ground to a halt. [[Image:Tehran-subway-station.jpg|left|200px|thumb|]] [[Image:Subway-train-interior.jpg|thumb|200px|left]] By the summer of 1985, urban pressure from the rapidly urbanising population, and lack of developed public transport system prompted the work to be resumed in earnest. 'Line 1' (From Blvd. Shahid Ayatollah Haghani to City of Rey) and its extension to Behesht-e-Zahra Cemetery was made a priority. 'Line 2' (From Dardasht in Tehran Pars district to Sadeghiyeh Second Square) and an extending towards the City of Karaj and Mehrshahr district was also made a secondary priority. Studies were also made to establish the previously designed Line 3 and 4. It was decided that an organisation by the name of the Metro Company should be established in order to handle the future development of the system. Following this phase, the Metro Company was managed by Asghar Ebrahimi Asl for eleven years. During this time, hundreds of millions of dollars were spent on the system and the Metro Company was given government concessions for the exploitation of iron ore mines in Bandar Abbas (Hormuzgan Province), exploitation and sale of Moghan Diotomite mine in Azarbaijan Province, export of refinery residues from Isfahan oil refinery as well as tar from Isfahan steel mill [http://www.msedv.com/rai/metro_history.html]. The year after Asghar Ebrahimi Asl left the management of the Metro Company and Mohsen Hashemi, the current Chairman of the company, succeeded him, the first line of the Tehran Metro was launched between Tehran and [[Karaj]]. On 7 March 1999, an overland Tehran-Karaj express electric train started a limited service of 31.4 km between Azadi Square (Tehran) and Malard (Karaj) calling at one intermediate station at Vardavard. The line was constructed by the Chinese company [[NORINCO]]. Line 5 of the [[Tehran]] metro began operating in the year 1999 and was [[Iran]]'s first [[rapid transit|metro]] system. [[Image:Golshahr metRo.jpg|thumb|Golshahr {line 5} rapid transit line stations.]] From 2000 onwards, commercial operation began on Lines 1 and 2. The wagons on these lines are provided by [[CNTIC]]. The railway tracks and points on these lines are provided by the [[Austria]]n company [[Voestalpine]]. The Metro uses equipments manufactured by a wide range of international companies: Double-deck passenger cars for the Tehran-Karaj commuter line are supplied by [[CNTIC]] and assembled by the [[Wagon Pars]] factory in Arak. To date, approximately 2 billion US dollars have been spent on the Metro project. The Tehran Metro is now transporting about 2.5 million passengers dailyhttp://en.trend.az/regions/iran/1840859.html through its 4 operational lines (1,2,4,5) with two lines (1 and 4) are still being developed by Tehran Metro Company with another two lines (Lines 3,7) under construction and the other two (Lines 6 and 8) in engineering phase. ==The lines== ===Line 1=== The line, coloured red on system maps, is currently 28.1 km long, of which 14.9 km are underground (from [[Gholhak Metro Station|Qolhak station]] to Shoush-Khayyam crossing) and the rest runs at surface level. The number of stations along this line is 26 of which 18 stations are located underground and 8 above ground. As of 2005, the total capacity of line 1 is 640,000 passenger per day, with trains stopping at each station for 20â30 seconds. The trains are each made up of seven wagons, with a nominal capacity of 1,290 seated and standing passengers. The maximum speed of the trains is 80 km per hour which will be tempered to an average of 37 km per hour due to stoppages at stations along the route. Line 1 runs mostly north-south. Extension of the line from [[Mirdamad Metro Station|Mirdamad station]] to Qolhak station 4.1 km, and three stations opened on May 20, 2009. The second phase of this extension Qolhak station to [[Tajrish Square]] 4 km and 4 stations, completed in 2011. Construction was to be completed by March 2007 but has faced major issues due to large boulders and rock bed in part of the tunnels and water drain issues. It has also faced major financing issues as the government has refused to release funds earmarked for the project to the municipality. {{Navbox |groupstyle = text-align:left; |liststyle = padding:0.25em 0; line-height:1.4em; |evenodd = swap |group1style = background:Red; color:white; |group1 = Line 1 |list1 = {{nowrap begin}} [[Tajrish square Metro Station|Tajrish]]{{Â·w}}[[Gheytariyeh Metro Station|Gheytariyeh]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahid Sadr Metro Station|Shahid Sadr]]{{Â·w}} [[Gholhak Metro Station|Gholhak]]{{Â·w}} [[Shariati Metro Station|Shari'ati]] {{Â·w}} [[Mirdamad Metro Station|Mirdamad]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahid Haghani Metro Station|Haghani]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahid Hemmat Metro Station|Hemmat]]{{Â·w}} [[Mosalla Metro Station|Mosalla]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahid Beheshti Metro Station|Beheshti]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahid Mofatteh Metro Station|Mofatteh]]{{Â·w}} [[Haft-e-Tir Metro Station|7th of Tir]]{{Â·w}} [[Taleghani Metro Station|Taleghani]]{{Â·w}} [[Darvaze Dolat Metro Station|Darvazeh Dowlat]]{{Â·w}} [[Saadi Metro Station|Saadi]]{{Â·w}} [[Imam Khomeini Metro Station|Imam Khomeini]]{{Â·w}} [[Panzdah-e-Khordad Metro Station|15th of Khordad]]{{Â·w}} [[Khayam Metro Station|Khayam]]{{Â·w}} [[Molavi Metro Station|Molavi]]{{Â·w}} [[Shush Metro Station|Shush]]{{Â·w}} [[Terminal-e Jonub Metro Station|South Terminal]]{{Â·w}} [[Khazane Metro Station|Khazaneh]]{{Â·w}} [[Ali Abad Metro Station|Ali Abad]]{{Â·w}} [[Javanmard-e-Ghassab Metro Station|Javanmard]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahr-e-Rey Metro Station|Shahr-e-Rey]]{{Â·w}} [[Bagher Shahr Metro Station|Bagher Shahr]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahed Metro Station|Shahed ]]{{Â·w}} [[Haram-e Motahhar Metro Station|Haram-e-Motahar]]{{Â·w}} [[Kahrizak Metro Station|Kahrizak ]]{{Â·w}} {{nowrap end}} }} ===Line 2=== This line, which opened between [[Sadeghieh (Tehran) Metro Station|Sadeghieh]] and [[Imam Khomeini Metro Station|Imam Khomeini]] in February 2000,{{Cite web | last =Schwandl | first =Robert | title =Tehran Metro | work =Asia - Iran | publisher =UrbanRail.net | date =2010 | url =http://www.urbanrail.net/as/tehr/tehran.htm | accessdate =17 January 2011 }} is 20.4 km long, with 19 km as a subway and 1.4 km elevated. There are 19 stations along this line, of which Imam Khomeini Station is shared by Line 1. Line 2 is coloured blue on system maps and runs mostly east-west through the city. The line was extended from Imam-Khomeini to [[Baharestan|Baharestan Metro Station]] in 2004, and to [[Shahid Madani Metro Station|Shahid Madani]], [[Sarsabz Metro Station|Sarsabz]] and [[Elm-o-Sanat University Metro Station|Elm-o-Sanat University]] in March 2006 with the intermediate stations, [[Darvaze Shemiran Metro Station|Darvazeh Shemiran]] and [[Sabalan Metro Station|Sabalan]], opening in July 2006. It was extended further from Elm-o-Sanat University to [[Tehran Pars Metro Station|Tehran Pars]] in February 2009, and to [[Farhangsara Metro Station|Farhangsara]] in June 2010. {{Navbox |groupstyle = text-align:left; |liststyle = padding:0.25em 0; line-height:1.4em; |evenodd = swap |group2style = background:Blue; color:white; |group2 = Line 2 |list2 = {{nowrap begin}}[[Farhang Sara Metro Station|Farhang Sara]]{{Â·w}} [[Tehran Pars Metro Station|Tehran Pars]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahid Bagheri Metro Station|Shahid Bagheri]]{{Â·w}} [[Elm-o-Sanat University Metro Station|Elm-o-Sanat University]]{{Â·w}} [[Sarsabz Metro Station|Sarsabz]]{{Â·w}} [[Golbarg Metro Station|Golbarg]]{{Â·w}} [[Fadak Metro Station|Fadak]]{{Â·w}} [[Sabalan Metro Station|Sabalan]]{{Â·w}} [[Shahid Madani Metro Station|Shahid Madani]]{{Â·w}} [[Imam Hossein Metro Station|Imam Hossein]]{{Â·w}} [[Darvaze Shemiran Metro Station|Darvazeh Shemiran]]{{Â·w}} [[Baharestan Metro Station|Baharestan]]{{Â·w}} [[Mellat Metro Station|Mellat]]{{Â·w}} [[Imam Khomeini Metro Station|Imam Khomeini]]{{Â·w}} [[Hasan Abad Metro Station|Hasan Abad]]{{Â·w}} [[Imam Ali University Metro Station|Imam Ali University]] {{Â·w}} [[Hor Square Metro Station|Meydan-e Hor]]{{Â·w}} [[Navvab Metro Station|Shahid Navvab-e Safavi]]{{Â·w}} [[Azadi Metro Station|Azadi]]{{Â·w}} [[Sharif University Metro Station|Sharif University]]{{Â·w}} [[Tarasht Metro Station|Tarasht]]{{Â·w}} [[Sadeghieh (Tehran) Metro Station|Sadeghieh (Tehran)]] {{nowrap end}} }} ===Line 3=== Its direction goes from northeast to southwest with plans for this line to be extended above ground to [[Imam Khomeini International Airport]], under construction. Line 3 will be among the most important lines as it connects southwest Tehran to northeast, crosses busy parts of the capital city and can alleviate traffic problems. The line should become fully operational in 3 years. About 7 km will be finished by 2011 followed by 12 km in 2012 and 16 km in 2013. http://www.payvand.com/news/10/dec/1146.html ===Line 4=== The line will be 20 km long with 22 stations and one terminal. Section 1, from Ferdowsi Square to Darvazeh Shemiran, opened in March 2007. Section 2 from Darvazeh shemiran to Shohada Square opened in February 2009. On May 24, 2009, Section 3 from Ferdowsi Square to Engelab Square opened. Currently there are 13 stations in operation on Line 4, coloured yellow on the system maps. Line 4 will be completed by 2011.http://www.tehranmetro.com/Services.aspx?pid=52 {{Navbox |groupstyle = text-align:left; |liststyle = padding:0.25em 0; line-height:1.4em; |evenodd = swap |group3style = background:Yellow; |group3 = Line 4 |list3 = {{nowrap begin}}[[Shahid Kolahdouz Metro Station|Shahid Kolahdouz]]{{Â·w}} [[Nabard Metro Station|Nabard]]{{Â·w}} [[Sheykhorreis Metro Station|Sheykhorreis]]{{Â·w}} [[Shohada Square Metro Station|Shohada Square]]{{Â·w}} [[Darvaze Shemiran Metro Station|Darvazeh Shemiran]]{{Â·w}} [[Darvaze Dolat Metro Station|Darvazeh Dowlat]]{{Â·w}} [[Ferdowsi Metro Station|Ferdowsi]]{{Â·w}} [[Vali-e-Asr Metro Station|Vali-e-Asr]]{{Â·w}} [[Enghelab Metro Station|Enghelab]]{{Â·w}} [[Tohid Metro Station|Tohid]]{{Â·w}} [[Ostad Moein Metro Station|Ostad Moein]]{{Â·w}} [[Doctor Habib-o-llah Metro Station|Doctor Habib-o-llah]]{{Â·w}} [[Azadi Metro Station|Azadi]]{{nowrap end}} }} ===Line 5=== The line coloured green on system maps, is 41.5 km long and has seven stations and one terminal. Entering the area of [[Karaj]] with main stations at [[Bonyad-e Rang]], Karaj and [[Mehrshahr]].It connects with the western end of Line 2 at Tehran (Sadeghiyeh) station. {{Navbox |groupstyle = text-align:left; |liststyle = padding:0.25em 0; line-height:1.4em; |evenodd = swap |group4style = background:Green; color:white; |group4 = Line 5 |list4 = {{nowrap begin}} [[Sadeghieh (Tehran) Metro Station|Sadeghieh (Tehran)]]{{Â·w}} [[Ekbatan Metro Station|Ekbatan]]{{Â·w}} [[Azadi Stadium Metro Station|Azadi Stadium]]{{Â·w}} [[Chitgar Metro Station|Chitgar]]{{Â·w}} [[Iran Khodro Metro Station|Iran Khodro]]{{Â·w}} [[Vardavard Metro Station|Vardavard]]{{Â·w}} [[Garmdare Metro Station|Garmdare]]{{Â·w}} [[Atmosfer Metro Station|Atomosfer]]{{Â·w}} [[Karaj Metro Station|Karaj]]{{Â·w}} [[Mahdasht Metro Station|Mahdasht]]{{Â·w}} [[Golshahr Metro Station|Golshahr]] {{nowrap end}} }} ===Line 7=== This line, in contrast with line 3, goes from northwest to southeast and is under construction with 2 recently bought modern TBM machines. == Art in Tehran Metro == A combination of modern art and traditional [[Persian art]] is prominent in every station of the Tehran Metro. ==Safety concerns & commuter perceptions== All routes have been equipped with ATP, ATS, CTC and SCADA. More and more residents use the metro due to the improvement in the peak-hour headways, the opening of more stations and overall improvement with new escalators, elevators and air-conditioning in the trains ===Accidents=== * On 18 July 2007, a twenty square metres area immediately adjacent to the entrance of the Toupkhaneh metro station caved in. There were no casualties, but the station had to undergo numerous repairs. ==Cultural damage== [[File:Mohsen Hashemi Rafsanjani.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Mohsen Hashemi Rafsanjani]], former president of Tehran Metro in the one of [[wagon]]s at the Tehran Metro]] The [[Cultural Heritage Organization of Iran]] has complained that the vibrations caused by the Metro were having a significant and highly adverse effect on the [[Masudieh Palace]] in the [[Baharestan]] neighbourhood of central Tehran [http://www.payvand.com/news/05/apr/1106.html]. The Cultural Heritage Organisation has also complained about vibrations near other historic sites such as the [[Golestan Palace]] and the [[National Museum of Iran]]. However, engineers and technical experts believe that it is the noise that induces the false sense of vibration and like many metro systems in large cities, no untoward impact is probable. == Metro Systems in other cities of Iran == * [[Mashhad Metro]] * [[Isfahan Metro]] * [[Shiraz Metro]] * [[Tabriz Metro]] * [[Ahvaz Metro]] ==See also== {{commons category|Tehran Metro}} * [[List of rapid transit systems]] * [[List of Tehran metro stations]] * [[Tehran Monorail]] * [[Transport in Iran]] * [[International rankings of Iran]] ==External links== *[http://www.tehranmetro.com Tehran Metro] *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hoxF-DlpCPQ&mode=related&search= Video Clip of one of the Tehran Metro stations] *[http://www.cityrailtransit.com/maps/tehran_map.htm Network map (to scale)] *[http://www.samsungapps.com/topApps/topAppsDetail.as?productId=G00000254610 Tehran Metro Application for badaOS] ==References== * http://www.msedv.com/rai/metro_history.html {{reflist}} {{Tehran Metro navbox}} [[Category:Tehran Metro| ]] [[Category:Underground rapid transit systems]] [[Category:Rail transport in Iran]] [[Category:1999 establishments in Iran]] [[Category:Standard gauge railways in Iran]] [[ar:ÙØªØ±Ù Ø·ÙØ±Ø§Ù]] [[bn:à¦¤à§à¦¹à¦°à¦¾à¦¨ à¦®à§à¦à§à¦°à§]] [[de:U-Bahn Teheran]] [[es:Metro de TeherÃ¡n]] [[eu:Teherango metroa]] [[fa:ÙØªØ±ÙÛ ØªÙØ±Ø§Ù]] [[fr:MÃ©tro de TÃ©hÃ©ran]] [[hy:Ô¹Õ¥Õ°ÖÕ¡Õ¶Õ« Õ´Õ¥Õ¿ÖÕ¸ÕºÕ¸Õ¬Õ«Õ¿Õ¥Õ¶]] [[it:Metropolitana di Teheran]] [[ka:áááá áááá¡ ááá¢á áááááá¢ááá]] [[nl:Metro van Teheran]] [[ja:ããã©ã³ã»ã¡ãã­]] [[pt:Metro de TeerÃ£o]] [[ru:Ð¢ÐµÐ³ÐµÑÐ°Ð½ÑÐºÐ¸Ð¹ Ð¼ÐµÑÑÐ¾Ð¿Ð¾Ð»Ð¸ÑÐµÐ½]] [[sv:Teherans tunnelbana]] [[tr:Tahran metrosu]] [[zh:å¾·é»è­å°éµ]]
